CatDescriptText: Miss Betty Martin, stenographer, 729 N. Main Street, Houston, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 25, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think those receiving Mother's Assistance should be required to report to the proper authorities just how all of the grant is spent, or should the present latitude in spending it be permitted to continue?" answer reads: "I think that they should be required to report how they spend the mother's assistance, because I don't think that they should be required to spend it if it is not done so in the right way."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Betty Martin wearing light colored blouse with floral embroidery on collar, holding newspaper and dark handbag, standing on Liberty Avenue with Jenkins Arcade marquee in background, Downtown
